intro: Brunia phylicoides, commonly known as the Cape rose or coastal rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal dunes and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize soil. Brunia phylicoides is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
